channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Flytipping, 1st August
item.description:
Bag on railings

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bishop's Bridge Road, Paddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large fly tip of bed bases and a shopping trolley full of rubbish., 1st August
item.description:
A large amount of fly tipping on the corner of Worsley Bridge Road and Meadowview Road. Bed bases and a shopping trolley full of rubbish has been dumped on the grass verge, looks awful and will encourage more fly tipping. Please can this be removed asap.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Meadowview Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned tent, 1st August
item.description:
A blue tent has been abandoned and left on Granville Place opposite the M&S loading bay along with a pallet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 19-25, Granville Place, Marylebone, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Clay and sand in the road, 1st August
item.description:
After dealing with a leak on the footpath, Thames water have left a large pile of clay and sand in the road which is very slippery and unsightly. It is blocking road use and may be a danger to pedestrians if they slip on it. Thames water have sent someone out to look but say they cannot clear it up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, East Woodside, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter bins along/near New River Walk regularly not emptied, 1st August
item.description:
I walk my dog along New River Walk. The bin on New River Way (near the bridge) is regularly full to overflowing as is the bin as you leave the New River Walk at Seven Sisters Road. The photo is of the bin on New River Way near to Skylark Point.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Newnton Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Group of abandoned lime bikes blocking the pavement T, 1st August
item.description:
Five (sorry make that six, another one has just abandoned one while I write this report) selfish lime bike users have abandoned life bikes on the pavement on a corner of a junction leaving pedestrians no option but to walk in the road to get past them.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bethwin Road, Camberwell, London
Report on FixMyStreet
